result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence Lee Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lawrence Lee Williams is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lawrence Lee Williams was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The court ordered a fine of $600.00 plus all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) due no later than 8-2-2023. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
On every vehicle owned or operated by the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence Lee Williams

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction; with credit for 148 DAYS served.  

The Court ordered a fine of $600.00 plus all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) due no later than 8-2-2023.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
The Court ordered License Revocaton and Ignition Interlock Device on every vehicle owned or operated by the defedant for a period of 24 MONTHS.

The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Lawrence Lee Williams in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Defendant Lawrence Lee Williams in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by the parties to criminal complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint. Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing.

e-Filed: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Lawrence Lee Williams not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court sets date.  Defense counsel leaves hearing before date is announced. 
... 
Case recalled at 2:40.  Same appearances.  Defense requests transfer to Judge Wagner, Branch 38 for a speedy disposition.  Court authorizes transfer.  Case adjourned for plea/sentencing hearing in Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Lawrence Lee Williams not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is waiting on the blood results from the lab analyst and requests an adjournment.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Lawrence Lee Williams not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
State emailed defense  discovery on 4-14-2022 and waiting for blood results before extending an Offer and and request an adjournment.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 This hearing will be be held in person. Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No driving.

Defendant Lawrence Lee Williams in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Due to reasons put forth on the record, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.
